CropRotationViz 0.1.0
  • Reference

Crop Sequence Builder Server Logic

Source: R/sequencer.R
sequencer_server.Rd

Implements the server-side logic for analyzing and managing agricultural crop rotation sequences. Provides comprehensive data processing, spatial analysis, and visualization capabilities for multi-year crop rotation patterns.

sequencer_server(
  input,
  output,
  session,
  app_data,
  output_dir = NA,
  common_column = NA,
  preview = TRUE,
  vector_file = TRUE
)

Arguments

input

Shiny input object containing UI input values

output

Shiny output object for rendering UI elements

session

Shiny session object managing the current user session

app_data

List containing application configuration and reference data:

  • Input_App_dataList containing:

    • codierung_allData frame mapping crop codes to names and classifications

    • crop_codesList defining crop code hierarchies and aggregations

    • display_namesNamed vector mapping internal codes to user-friendly names

    • EZGAdditional reference data for crop classification

output_dir

Character string specifying default output directory path. Default: NA

common_column

Character string specifying a default column for crop identification across files. Default: NA

preview

logical. If True (default) you get a snapshot as png from your processed data as sankey chart in PNG format.

vector_file

logical. If True (default) you will get a vector file as an additional output with all intersected and aggregated field data.

Value

Reactive expression containing a list of processed files with their metadata:

  • sf_objectSimple features object containing spatial data

  • selected_columnName of column containing crop information

  • selected_yearYear assigned to the dataset

  • filepathOriginal file path

Details

The server component implements several key functionalities:

  • Data Management

    • Dynamic file loading and validation for multiple spatial formats

    • Automatic column detection and mapping

    • Year assignment and sequence tracking

    • Interactive map visualization with bounding box display

  • Spatial Processing

    • Support for multiple spatial file formats (.shp, .geojson, .fgb, .gpkg, .sqlite)

    • Two intersection methods: complete (preserving all areas) and fast (optimized for performance)

    • Optional crop class aggregation based on national coding system

    • Area calculations and spatial transformations

  • Progress Tracking

    • Real-time validation feedback

    • File loading status updates

    • Processing progress indicators

    • Error handling and notifications

  • Output Generation

    • Multiple export format options (Shapefile, GeoPackage, FlatGeobuf)

    • Comprehensive metadata documentation

    • Sankey diagram visualization of crop sequences

    • RData file with processed results

Processing Workflow

The server follows a structured workflow:

  1. File validation and loading

  2. Column mapping and year assignment

  3. Spatial intersection processing

  4. Optional crop class aggregation

  5. Area calculations and statistics

  6. Output file generation

  7. Visualization creation

Performance Considerations

  • Automatic detection and warning for large datasets (>100,000 features)

  • Memory-efficient processing for spatial operations

  • Progress tracking for long-running operations

  • Optimized intersection methods for different use cases

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Basic server initialization
server <- function(input, output, session) {
  sequencer_server(input, output, session, app_data)
}

# Server with custom output directory and column mapping
server <- function(input, output, session) {
  sequencer_server(
    input, 
    output, 
    session, 
    app_data,
    output_dir = "path/to/output",
    common_column = "crop_code"
  )
}
} # }
